org.itemscript.standard
Class FileConnectorBase

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.connectors.ConnectorBase
      org.itemscript.standard.FileConnectorBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connector, SyncBrowseConnector, SyncGetConnector, HasSystem
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinaryFileConnector, JsonFileConnector, TextFileConnector
public abstract class FileConnectorBase
extends ConnectorBase
implements SyncGetConnector, SyncBrowseConnector

Base Connector class for file connectors.

Note: At present support for file connectors is fairly minimal; loading of file resources on other servers is not supported, nor are pagedItems or pagedKeys methods from SyncBrowseConnector, nor is SyncPutConnector.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

countItems

public final JsonObject countItems(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "countItems" key. It must return a JsonObject with a "count" field with an integer value corresponding to the number of sub-items of the item given by the URL path, like this: 
 {
     "count" : 1000000
 }
Connectors that cannot return a count of sub-items should return a JsonObject exactly like this: 
 {
     "countType":"unknown",
     "count" : -1
 }
Connectors that cannot return an accurate count of sub-items but can return an approximate number should return a JsonObject looking like this: 
 {
     "countType":"approximate",
     "count":1000000
 }
where 1000000 should be a JsonNumber with the approximate number of sub-items.

Specified by:
countItems in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonNumber with the count of sub-items, or a JsonObject as above.

getKeys

public final JsonArray getKeys(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "keys" key. It must return a JsonArray containing the keys for the sub-items of the item given by the URL path as JsonStrings. Connectors that cannot return a full list of keys should return a single page of keys, as if SyncBrowseConnector.pagedKeys(org.itemscript.core.url.Url) was called without specifying a start row or number of rows to return.

Specified by:
getKeys in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray with the keys of sub-items as JsonStrings.

pagedItems

public final JsonArray pagedItems(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "pagedItems" key. It must return a JsonArray in which each element is a JsonArray with two entries: the first entry must be a JsonString giving the key of the sub-item, and the second entry must be the actual value associated with that sub-item. For instance: 
 [
     [
         "one",
         {
             "actual":"value"
         }
     ],
     [
         "two",
         {
             "another":"value"
         }
     ]
 ]
Sorting and paging keys in the query will be used to determine the ordering and number of results, as with the SyncBrowseConnector.pagedKeys(org.itemscript.core.url.Url) method. The sorting of the results should be alphabetically by key, or failing that, any other deterministic method of sorting.

Specified by:
pagedItems in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray with contents as specified above.

pagedKeys

public final JsonArray pagedKeys(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "pagedKeys" key. It must return a JsonArray in which each entry is a JsonString containing the key of a sub-item of the item pointed to by the URL. The following keys, if present, control the paging and ordering behavior of the query:
  • "startRow" - The row to begin the page of keys, where 0 would be the first row.
  • "numRows" - The number of rows to return in the page of keys.
The sorting of the results should be alphabetically by key, or failing that, any other deterministic method of sorting.

Specified by:
pagedKeys in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray containing JsonStrings giving the keys of sub-items.
